com.selesse.jxlint

Class Jxlint

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.selesse.jxlint.Jxlint

  • public class Jxlint
extends java.lang.Object
    Entry-point to the jxlint framework. This should be called only after customizing Reporters (if desired). Pass your program's command line arguments to parseArgumentsAndDispatch(String[])}, jxlint will do the rest! Sample implementation is shown below: 
         public class MyApplication {
         public static void main (String[] args) {
             Jxlint jxlint = new Jxlint(new MyLintRules(), new MyProgramSettings());
             jxlint.parseArgumentsAndDispatch(args);
         }
     }

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Jxlint(LintRules lintRules, ProgramSettings programSettings)
      Initializes jxlint with a set of rules (LintRules and program settings ProgramSettings).
      Jxlint(LintRules lintRules, ProgramSettings programSettings, boolean exitAfterReporting)
      Same as Jxlint(com.selesse.jxlint.model.rules.LintRules, com.selesse.jxlint.settings.ProgramSettings), but explicitly specify if we'll use System.exit(int) after reporting.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Jxlint

        public Jxlint(LintRules lintRules,
      ProgramSettings programSettings)
        Initializes jxlint with a set of rules (LintRules and program settings ProgramSettings). This will make the program call System.exit(int) under circumstances described in ExitType.

      • Jxlint

        public Jxlint(LintRules lintRules,
      ProgramSettings programSettings,
      boolean exitAfterReporting)
        Same as Jxlint(com.selesse.jxlint.model.rules.LintRules, com.selesse.jxlint.settings.ProgramSettings), but explicitly specify if we'll use System.exit(int) after reporting.

    • Method Detail

      • setCustomCategories

        public void setCustomCategories(java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.Enum<?>> categories)

      • parseArgumentsAndDispatch

        public void parseArgumentsAndDispatch(java.lang.String[] args)
        Parses the command line arguments, and calls the Dispatcher to decide what to do next. Makes sure that there are no Exceptions thrown when parsing the command line arguments.
        Parameters:
        args - Your program's command line arguments.
